projects.title: Wine Collection App
projects.desc: A collection app that used Sequal Pro to manage the DB. I used PHP to manipulate data from DB to display, add and delete wines from the app. Includes unit tested functions.

projects.title: Finance Calculator App
projects.desc: I used JS to process input and a mixture of vanilla JS and jQuery to manipulate the output. Handlebars was used to populate a dynamic table of results

projects.title: Pairs Game Browser App
projects.desc: Written in a functional programming format in JS, we used a fetch to call function and populate html dynamically from a local json file. HTML and CSS for front end.

projects.title: Make A Meal Of It
projects.desc: Using a combination of Sequel Pro and a recipe API, we built an OOP PHP app using curl, hydrator classes and view helper classes. Includes Unit Tests.

projects.title: Pokedex!
projects.desc: A pokedex written in OOP using PHP. I used a hydrator class to instantiate each pokemon through a pokemonEntity class and dynamically display from a DB.

projects.title: Estimate Age & Nationality
projects.desc: Taking a given name and dynamically populating at chart as well as estimated age using a series of Async & Await functions and outputting display with Chart.js.

projects.title: Gits Got Talent
projects.desc: I built a page that displays the current top 3 rated profiles on git. Experimenting with git's own API and using handlebars to output results.

projects.title: Simple Login & Click Game
projects.desc: As a little challenge, used JS setInterval(), createElement() and apendChild() to create simple click game. Included a login page with PHP using SESSION.

projects.title: Pilot Project
projects.desc: Given a JSON object, dynamically filling the products section of a page using handlebars. Omitted displaying an HTML element if data not in object.

projects.title: First Ever Portfolio Build!
projects.desc: After 1 week of at Mayden Academy, built my first portfolio website with HTML, CSS and some basic jQuery to animate sections in as well as a burger menu.

projects.title: Second & Current Portfolio
projects.desc: 9 weeks into the Mayden bootcamp, decided to have a go re-doing my online portfolio. I used gulp to manage SASS and Babel, handlebars and JS to dynamically display my projects from a local JSON file and chart.js to help illustrated my confidence and skill with the given tools picked up at the 16 week Bootcamp.
